alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Metro Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Collier, Broward and southwestern Palm Beach Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 236 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, or 13 miles west of Sunrise, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pembroke Pines, Coral Springs, Sunrise, Tamarac, Weston, Parkland, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, Miccosukee Service Plaza, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, Miccosukee Indian Reservation, East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Loxahatchee NWR, Markham Park and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Metro Broward County
